identificationModule.briefTitle: A Dose Ranging Phase IIa Study of 6 Hour Intravenous Dosages of CXL-1427 in Patients Hospitalized With Heart Failure
identificationModule.officialTitle: A Phase IIa Study of the Safety, Tolerability and Hemodynamic Effects of a Continuous 6 Hour Intravenous Infusion of CXL-1427 in Hospitalized Patients With Systolic Heart Failure

descriptionModule.briefSummary: A randomized, double-blinded, placebo-controlled study of continuous 6-hour IV infusions of CXL-1427 in hospitalized patients with systolic heart failure.
descriptionModule.detailedDescription: This is a dose finding, randomized, double-blinded, placebo-controlled study of continuous 6-hour IV infusions of CXL-1427 in hospitalized patients with systolic heart failure which will first evaluate up to four ascending dose levels of CXL-1427 in up to four cohorts of 8 patients each (the "Dose Escalation" cohorts). Subsequently, up to three of the initial dose levels of CXL-1427 may be assessed in the additional "Expansion" cohorts of up to approximately 16 patients to gain further confidence in the results at these dose levels. The CXL-1427 dose that will be evaluated in the first cohort will be 3µg/kg/min. The dose levels for the next three sequential Dose Escalation cohorts will be dependent on clinical safety and tolerability, as well as the results of the invasive hemodynamic measurements.

armGroups.label: CXL-1427 Starting Dose
armGroups.description: The Starting dose of CXL-1427 in the dose escalation arms will be 3mcg/kg/min

armGroups.label: CXL-1427 Dose Level 2
armGroups.description: The Second Dose level of CXL-1427 will be evaluated in the Dose Escalation Arm of the study as determined by the independent dose escalation committee

armGroups.label: CXL-1427 Dose Level 3
armGroups.description: The Third Dose level of CXL-1427 will be evaluated in the Dose Escalation Arm of the study as determined by the independent dose escalation committee

armGroups.label: CXL-1427 Dos Level 3
armGroups.description: The Third Dose level of CXL-1427 will be evaluated in the Dose Escalation Arm of the study as determined by the independent dose escalation committee

armGroups.label: CXL-1427 Dose Level 4
armGroups.description: The forth level of CXL-1427 will be evaluated in the Dose Escalation Arm of the study as determined by the independent dose escalation committee

armGroups.label: Expansion Cohort 1
armGroups.description: Up to 16 Patients will be enrolled across 1 or more of the previously evaluated Dose escalation Levels as determined by the independent dose escalation committee

armGroups.label: Placebo for Dose Escalation and Expansion Cohort
armGroups.description: Each Dose escalation Arm of the study will have a placebo group in a 2:1 ratio to active treatment for the first 3 patients enrolled and 4:1 to active treatment in the remaining 5 patients so that the overall randomization ratio in each Dose escalation arm will be 3:1 active to placebo. In the expansion Cohort of the study, the ratio of patients randomized to receive a 6-hour infusion of active CXL-1427 or placebo will be 3:1

interventions.name: Placebo
armGroupLabels: Placebo for Dose Escalation and Expansion Cohort
otherNames: 5% Dextrose & 10mM potassium acetate as same IV solution diluents used in active

primaryOutcomes.measure: Number of Participants With Treatment-Emergent Adverse Events
primaryOutcomes.description: A treatment-emergent adverse event (TEAE) was defined as an AE with onset after the start of the study drug infusion at Hour 00:00 through 30 days after the stop of the study drug infusion. All TEAEs and pertinent subsets of TEAEs (e.g., TEAEs with onset during the infusion of study drug, serious TEAEs, etc.) were summarized by system organ class (SOC), preferred term (PT) and treatment group
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: 30 days following the initiation of treatment

primaryOutcomes.measure: Mean Time Averaged Change From Baseline in Adjudicated Pulmonary Capillary Wedge Pressure (PCWP) During Infusion
primaryOutcomes.description: The effect of CXL-1427 on PCWP is presented as the mean time-averaged change from baseline over the course of infusion of CXL-1427 or placebo in adjudicated pulmonary capillary wedge pressure (PCWP) on a modified intent-to-treat population
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Baseline, Hour 2, Hour 4, Hour 6, Hour 8 post infusion

primaryOutcomes.measure: Mean Time-Averaged Change From Baseline in Adjudicated Pulmonary Artery Diastolic Pressure (PAD) During the Infusion
primaryOutcomes.description: Pulmonary artery diastolic pressure (PAD) was measured by an indwelling PA catheter. Pulmonary artery diastolic pressure (PAD) approximates pulmonary capillary wedge pressure in normal individuals. The effects of CXL-1427 on time-averaged PAD during the course of the infusion are presented.
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Baseline, Hour 2, Hour 4, Hour 6, Hour 8 post infusion initiation

primaryOutcomes.measure: Mean Time-Averaged Percent Change From Baseline in Cardiac Index (Fick)
primaryOutcomes.description: Cardiac index is a measure of cardiac function, relating the cardiac output from the left ventricle in one minute to body surface area. It is calculated using the Fick principle, using oxygen consumption measured with a metabolic cart, hemoglobin levels, and the difference between arterial and superior vena cava oxygen saturation measured by co-oximetry. Cardiac index as calculated by the Fick method was performed using an assumed oxygen consumption value of 125 ml/min per m2 of body surface area. i.e., an assumed Fick method.
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Baseline, Hour 2, Hour 4, Hour 6, Hour 8 post infusion initiation

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Mean Time-Averaged Change From Baseline in Adjudicated Pulmonary Artery Systolic Pressure (PAS) During the Infusion
secondaryOutcomes.description: Pulmonary artery systolic pressure (PAS) was measured by an indwelling PA catheter. The effects of CXL-1427 on time-averaged PAS during the course of the infusion are presented
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Baseline, Hour 2, Hour 4, Hour 6, Hour 8 post infusion initiation

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Mean Time-Averaged Change From Baseline in Adjudicated Right Atrial Pressure (RAP) During the Infusion
secondaryOutcomes.description: The effects of CXL-1427 on time-averaged RAP during the course of the infusion are presented
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Baseline, Hour 2, Hour 4, Hour 6, Hour 8 post infusion initiation

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Mean Time-Averaged Change From Baseline in Mean Arterial Blood Pressure (MAP) During the Infusion
secondaryOutcomes.description: Mean arterial pressure during infusion of CXL-1427 or placebo on a modified intent-to-treat population is presented
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Baseline, Hour 24 after infusion, Follow-up visit 1

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Mean Time-Averaged Change From Baseline in Systolic Blood Pressure (SBP) During the Infusion
secondaryOutcomes.description: Mean Time-Averaged Change from Baseline in Systolic Blood Pressure during infusion of CXL-1427 or placebo on a modified intent-to-treat population is presented
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Baseline, Hour 24 after infusion, Follow-up visit 1

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Mean Time-Averaged Change From Baseline in Diastolic Blood Pressure (DBP) During the Infusion
secondaryOutcomes.description: Mean Time-Averaged Change from Baseline in Diastolic Blood Pressure during infusion of CXL-1427 or placebo on a modified intent-to-treat population is presented
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Baseline, Hour 24 after infusion, Follow-up visit 1

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Mean Time-Averaged Change From Baseline in Heart Rate (HR) During the Infusion
secondaryOutcomes.description: Mean Time-Averaged Change from Baseline in Heart Rate during infusion of CXL-1427 or placebo on a modified intent-to-treat population is presented
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Baseline, Hour 24 after infusion, Follow-up visit 1

participantFlowModule.preAssignmentDetails: A total of 70 participants were enrolled of which only 46 participants received treatment. 24 were not treated due to screen failures, 3 of the 24 were randomized but not dosed due to other reasons.

groups.title: Placebo
groups.description: Subjects received matching placebo intravenous (IV) infusion.

groups.title: CXL-1427 3μg/kg/Min
groups.description: Subjects received CXL-1427 3 microgram per kilogram per minute (μg/kg/min) IV infusion as 90 milliliter (mL) of dosing solution at a rate of 15 milliliter per hour (mL/hour) for six hours.

groups.title: CXL-1427 5μg/kg/Min
groups.description: Subjects received CXL-1427 5 μg/kg/min IV infusion as 90 mL of dosing solution at a rate of 15 mL/hour for six hours.

groups.title: CXL-1427 7μg/kg/Min
groups.description: Subjects received CXL-1427 7 μg/kg/min IV infusion as 150 mL of dosing solution at a rate of 25 mL/hour for six hours.

groups.title: CXL-1427 12μg/kg/Min
groups.description: Subjects received CXL-1427 12 μg/kg/min IV infusion as 180 mL of dosing solution at a rate of 30 mL/hour for six hours.

outcomeMeasures.title: Number of Participants With Treatment-Emergent Adverse Events
outcomeMeasures.description: A treatment-emergent adverse event (TEAE) was defined as an AE with onset after the start of the study drug infusion at Hour 00:00 through 30 days after the stop of the study drug infusion. All TEAEs and pertinent subsets of TEAEs (e.g., TEAEs with onset during the infusion of study drug, serious TEAEs, etc.) were summarized by system organ class (SOC), preferred term (PT) and treatment group
outcomeMeasures.populationDescription: The safety analysis set consists of all randomized participants who received all or part of the infusion of the study drug.
outcomeMeasures.timeFrame: 30 days following the initiation of treatment

adverseEventsModule.timeFrame: All adverse events were reported from signed of informed consent form through 30 days post final infusion of study drug.

eventGroups.description: Subjects received CXL-1427 12 μg/kg/min IV infusion as 180 mL of dosing solution at a rate of 30 mL/hour for six hours.

otherEvents.organSystem: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certainAgreement.otherDetails: Bristol-Myers Squibb Co. agreements with investigators vary; constant is our right to embargo communications regarding trial results prior to public release for a period ≤60 days from submittal for review. We will not prohibit investigators from publishing, but will prohibit the disclosure of previously undisclosed confidential information other than study results, and request postponement of single-center publications until after disclosure of the clinical trial's primary publication.
